msItem.author: ANSELM
msItem.title: A combination of the Meditationes and Orationes
msItem.note: (Sharpe, no. 120 [59–61]), ed. Franciscus S. Schmitt, Sancti Anselmi Opera, 6 vols. (Edinburgh, 1946–61), 3:3, 11–83. The text varies from the order printed, probably because of misplacement and loss of leaves, not as Southern (see the next) suggests (p. xxi), because it is an early recension. In order, the MS presents meditatio 1, oratio 2, meditatio 2, orationes 18–19 and a brief piece not in the printed text (fols. 7–8), inc. ‘Domina mea dominatrix mea ’; orationes 5–6, 8–13, 15, 14, 16, 7, 17, and 4 (the explicit at edn. 12).

msItem.title: Hymns for church use on Sundays and feast days with musical notation.
msItem.note: Fol. 139v is blank but partially ruled and fols. vi–viii are blank. Fols. 131–9, ?vi–viii are an extra quire added from another source. Writing area 160 87 . In long lines, 12 (with red four-line staves) lines to the page. Prickings; bounded and ruled in lead. Written in caroline, s. xii1.

supportDesc.extent:
Fols. v + 142 (numbered fols. 1–139, vi–viii) + iii (numbered fols. ix–xi). 207 128
155–60 89
supportDesc.collation: 1–28 38 (3 and 6 singles) 4–88 910 (3 and 8 singles) [fol. 74, a booklet boundary] | 10–128 138 (3 and 6 singles) 148 158 (3 and 6 singles) 168 [fol. 130, originally the end of the MS] | apparently 712+1 (+7; –13, an excised blank). No catchwords. Each quire signed at the foot of the first recto with a roman numeral in crayon; quires 1–16 = i–xvi. Fols. 131 and 137 are certainly single, and fol. vi is certainly the conjoint of fol. 134. But fols. vii–viii may be binding material, and three leaves may be excised at the end.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in long lines, 31 lines to the page. Frequent prickings; bounded and ruled in brown ink and crayon.

handDesc.handNote: Written in protogothic bookhand by a number of scribes, often alternating after very brief stints. Punctuation most fully by point, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus, but often by point only.

decoDesc.decoNote: In text portions, headings in red, alternate red and blue two- and three-line arabesque initials, a few with designs in the other colour (in text 1, the last example at fol. 43v, and some green initials).
In the musical portion, red headings, alternate red and green one-line arabesque initials.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on four thongs. At the front, a marbled paper leaf (dated 1842), two modern paper flyleaves, and two medieval vellum leaves (a bifolium); at the rear, two modern paper flyleaves, and another marbled leaf (ix–xi).

history.provenance: Three notes from Augustine (fol. vv, textura, s. xiii).
A brief distinctio concerning occasions when fornication is a sin (fol. viiv, s. xiii).

‘Liber sancti marci Bristoll’ ex dono Sauarici de Lya presbiteri hac condicione quod si Exsecutores Roberti de Thornbir’ presbiteri eum iusto titulo exigant reddatur eis’ (fol. v, partly cut off at the top; s. xiii/xiv) (Ker, MLGB 13, 231).
A contents list (fol. vv, s. xvi/xvii).
